TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1150-1151
TEI.2.document_title: Keep, Groce, Stephen F Austin to Stephen F Austin, 07-19-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Procedure in a maritime insurance case, July [19?], 1825. Keep and Groce. Trade with New Orleans.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1150-1151

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Procedure in a maritime insurance case, July [19?], 1825. Keep and Groce. Trade with New Orleans.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*It appearing by the protest of the *person_mentioned*Master and Mate of the Schooner Lady of the Lake*/person_mentioned* of and from *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* and other evidence herewith presented, that a part of the Merchandise shipped on board of said Schooner were damaged by the sea water that leaked into her, and the said Goods having been insured by the *person_mentioned*Louisiana Company*/person_mentioned* and their being no *person_mentioned*port wardens*/person_mentioned* or other *person_mentioned*Officers */person_mentioned*here specially appointed to attend to such matters— Therefore the Undersigned *person_mentioned*Consignees*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Owners */person_mentioned*of said Goods petition that *person_mentioned*appraisers */person_mentioned*be appointed to examine said Goods and assess the damage under oath and should the damage amount to more than 5 per Cent on said Goods your *person_mentioned*petitioners */person_mentioned*pray that the goods so damaged may be sold at public sale under the direction of said *person_mentioned*Appraisers */person_mentioned*for the benefit of the *person_mentioned*Underwriters*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Groce*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*To the *person_mentioned*Honbl. Stephen F Austin Judge of the *location_mentioned*Brazos*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned* and*location_mentioned* San Jacinto*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*United Mexican States Department of Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Jurisdiction of the Brazos Colorado and San Jacinto*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*I *person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin Principal Judge of the Jurisdiction */person_mentioned*aforesaid having seen the above petition of *person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Groce */person_mentioned*have thought proper to appoint and by these presents do appoint *person_mentioned*Samuel Sexton*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Samuel M Williams*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Elias R Wightman*/person_mentioned* *person_mentioned*inspectors */person_mentioned*or *person_mentioned*appraisers*/person_mentioned* to examine and estimate the damage done to the Goods refered to in the said petition and should the damage on any of the articles amount to five per cent that they assess the proportion of said damage and sell the articles so damaged at public sale, after giving 10 days public notice for a/c of the Concerned and that the said *person_mentioned*Appraisers */person_mentioned*furnish the parties with a Certificate specifying the proportion of damage said goods may have sustained Given under my hand this *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1825">[19 ?] day of July 1825*/date_mentioned* In the *location_mentioned*District of San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p**location_mentioned*Department of Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*District of San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*This day personally appeared before me *person_mentioned*Stephen F Austin Judge of this *location_mentioned*Jurisdiction*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Samuel Sexton*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Samuel M William*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Elias R Wightman*/person_mentioned* who took an oath well and truly to inspect the goods submitted to their inspection refered to in the petition of *person_mentioned*Keep */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Groce */person_mentioned*and to assess the proportion of damage on said Goods and to do and perform the other duties required of them in the order of *person_mentioned*Judge Austin*/person_mentioned* on the subject to the best of their abilities*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
